item.title: Introducing MSVC AddressSanitizer for ARM64 targets
item.description: We are pleased to announce√Ç¬†AddressSanitizer√Ç¬†(ASan) support for the Microsoft C++ (MSVC) Build Tools for√Ç¬†ARM64 targets.√Ç¬†ASan is a runtime memory error detector that√Ç Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cppblog/introducing-msvc-addresssanitizer-for-arm64-targets

item.title: Your complete guide to Amazon Quick Suite at AWS re:Invent 2025
item.description: This year, re:Invent will be held in Las Vegas, Nevada, from December 1 to December 5, 2025, and this guide will help you navigate our comprehensive session catalog and plan your week. The sessions cater to business and technology leaders, product and engineering teams, and data and analytics teams interested in incorporating agentic AI capabilities across their teams and organization. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/your-complete-guide-to-amazon-quick-suite-at-aws-reinvent-2025/

item.title: Accelerate enterprise solutions with agentic AI-powered consulting: Introducing AWS Professional Service Agents
item.description: I'm excited to announce AWS Professional Services now offers specialized AI agents including the AWS Professional Services Delivery Agent. This represents a transformation to the consulting experience that embeds intelligent agents throughout the consulting life cycle to deliver better value for customers. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/accelerate-enterprise-solutions-with-agentic-ai-powered-consulting-introducing-aws-professional-service-agents/

item.title: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Claude: Transforming business with agentic AI
item.description: In this post, we explore how Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Claude are enabling enterprises like Cox Automotive and Druva to deploy production-ready agentic AI systems that deliver measurable business value, with results including up to 63% autonomous issue resolution and 58% faster response times. We examine the technical foundation combining Claude's frontier AI capabilities with AgentCore's enterprise-grade infrastructure that allows organizations to focus on agent logic rather than building complex operational systems from scratch.

item.title: Introducing C# 14
item.description: C# 14 ships with .NET 10. The highlight is new extension members, but there's a lot more features that make your life as a developer more productive. And, we've added new features that enable some of the performance improvements you can experience in .NET 10. Read on for a tour of all the new features, and find links to dive de Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/introducing-csharp-14

item.title: Introducing F# 10
item.description: F# 10 is now shipping with .NET 10 and Visual Studio 2026. This version is a refinement release focused on clarity, consistency, and performance, bringing small but meaningful improvements that make your everyday code more legible and robust. You can get F# 10 today in a few ways: Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/introducing-fsharp-10

item.title: How can I detect that Windows is running in S-Mode, redux
item.description: Igor Levicki asked for a plain C version of the sample code to detect whether Windows is running in S-Mode. I didn't write one for two reasons. First, I didn't realize that so many people still tried to use COM from plain C. A Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251117-00/?p=111795

item.title: Database Features in Rider
item.description: Rider provides robust support for working with databases directly within the IDE ‚Äì powered by DataGrip! Rider and DataGrip smooth development workflows by allowing you to manage and interact with a variety of database systems. This integration enhances productivity for developers who frequently work with data.¬†Database projects and connectivity There has long been support [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/11/17/database-features-in-rider/

item.title: Optimize GUID creation performance in .NET applications
item.description: Many .NET projects use well-known GUIDs as identifiers for activities, interop scenarios, database keys, and other purposes. It's common to see code like new Guid("01234567-8901-2345-6789-012345678901") throughout applications. While this approach is readable and straightforward, it comes with a hidden performance cost that can impact application startup time. This is a micro-optimization that primarily‚Ä¶ Link to article: https://www.meziantou.net/optimize-guid-creation-performance-in-dotnet-applications.htm?utm_medium=social&utm_source=syndication

item.title: How to Prepare for the Future of Programming
item.description: Start a start-up? Scratch that. Call your mom. Go back to school? Don‚Äôt go back to school. Learn to code? Don‚Äôt learn to code. Forget coding. Only prompt engineering matters now. Actually, I heard it‚Äôs overrated. You think we‚Äôre gonna be prompting in 5 years? 2 years? Nonsense. All this hype is being blown so [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/education/2025/11/17/how-to-prepare-for-the-future-of-programming/

item.title: Mark Your Calendars! Qodana Events in November
item.description: As 2025 starts racing to a close, the JetBrains Qodana team is ending the year with a series of events dedicated to what matters most in modern software development: secure workflows, high-quality code, and practical tooling that empowers developers to ship with confidence. Whether you‚Äôre working in security engineering, backend development, DevOps, or AI-powered applications, [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/qodana/2025/11/mark-your-calendars-qodana-events-in-november/

item.description: OpenAI has been named an Emerging Leader in Gartner‚Äôs 2025 Innovation Guide for Generative AI Model Providers. The recognition reflects our enterprise momentum, with over 1 million companies building with ChatGPT. Link to article: https://openai.com/index/gartner-2025-emerging-leader

item.title: Implement forgot your password using swiyu, ASP.NET Core Identity and Aspire
item.description: This post show to implement a ‚ÄúForgot your password‚Äù flow using the Swiss Digital identity and trust infrastructure, (swiyu) in an ASP.NET Core web application using ASP.NET Core Identity and Duende IdentityServer. The generic containers from swiyu are used to integrate the Swiss E-ID and the OpenID for Verifiable Presentations standards. .NET Aspire is used [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://damienbod.com/2025/11/17/implement-forgot-your-password-using-swiyu-asp-net-core-identity-and-aspire/

item.title: Why Diffusion Models Could Change Developer Workflows in 2026
item.description: Developers spend much of their time editing, refactoring, and debugging rather than producing entirely new code. Code creation tends to involve non-sequential back-and-forth refinement rather than typing out a complete function in one uninterrupted sequence. You might sketch a part, adjust parameters, skip ahead, then revisit earlier sections to refine them.¬†Diffusion models, and in [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/11/why-diffusion-models-could-change-developer-workflows-in-2026/

item.title: Defensive Programming Rule #4: Safe and Efficient Type Casting
item.description: This article emphasizes defensive programming by highlighting safe type compatibility checks in .NET. It advises using the 'is' keyword to prevent InvalidCastException and warns against unnecessary type casts that clutter code and affect performance. The open-source project Spargine aids developers with tools for better validation and logging, promoting cleaner, more resilient applications. Link to article: https://dotnettips.wordpress.com/2025/11/16/defensive-programming-rule-4-safe-and-efficient-type-casting/

item.title: Is My Developer Career JUST Maintenance?! - Dev Leader Weekly 116
item.description: Welcome to another issue of Dev Leader Weekly! In this issue, I discuss just how much of our developer careers are maintaining software systems. Link to article: https://www.devleader.ca/2025/11/15/is-my-developer-career-just-maintenance-dev-leader-weekly-116

item.title: Weekly Recap - 2025-11-14
item.description: Check out this week from Dev Leader! Here's a list including articles and videos on software engineering, career development, and programming in C#! Link to article: https://www.devleader.ca/2025/11/15/weekly-recap-20251114

item.title: Exploring C# File-based Apps in .NET 10
item.description: With .NET 10, Microsoft introduced file-based apps, which give you the ability to write C# code in a single .cs file and run it directly, without any project or solution files. This feature finally makes C# approachable for quick scripts and utilities Link to article: https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog/exploring-csharp-file-based-apps-in-dotnet-10

item.title: Build a biomedical research agent with Biomni tools and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Gateway
item.description: In this post, we demonstrate how to build a production-ready biomedical research agent by integrating Biomni's specialized tools with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Gateway, enabling researchers to access over 30 biomedical databases through a secure, scalable infrastructure. The implementation showcases how to transform research prototypes into enterprise-grade systems with persistent memory, semantic tool discovery, and comprehensive observability for scientific reproducibility . Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/build-a-biomedical-research-agent-with-biomni-tools-and-amazon-bedrock-agentcore-gateway/

item.title: Make your web apps hands-free with Amazon Nova Sonic
item.description: Graphical user interfaces have carried the torch for decades, but today‚Äôs users increasingly expect to talk to their applications. In this post we show how we added a true voice-first experience to a reference application‚Äîthe¬†Smart¬†Todo¬†App‚Äîturning routine task management into a fluid, hands-free conversation. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/make-your-web-apps-hands-free-with-amazon-nova-sonic/

item.title: Harnessing the power of generative AI: Druva‚Äôs multi-agent copilot for streamlined data protection
item.description: Generative AI is transforming the way businesses interact with their customers and revolutionizing conversational interfaces for complex IT operations. Druva, a leading provider of data security solutions, is at the forefront of this transformation. In collaboration with Amazon Web Services (AWS), Druva is developing a cutting-edge generative AI-powered multi-agent copilot that aims to redefine the customer experience in data security and cyber resilience. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/harnessing-the-power-of-generative-ai-druvas-multi-agent-copilot-for-streamlined-data-protection/

When those foundations contain vulnerabilities, every service built on top inherits the same risk.¬†Docker Hardened Images addresses this at the source. These are continuously-maintained, minimal base images designed for security: stripped of unnecessary packages, patched proactively,... Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/making-the-most-of-your-docker-hardened-images-trial-part-1/

item.title: I can use WM_COPYDATA to send a block of data to another window, but how does it send data back?
item.description: The WM_COPY¬≠DATA message can be used to send a blob of data from one window to another. The window manager does the work of copying the data from the sending process to the receiving process, but how does the receiving process send data back? If the only information that needs to come back is a success/failure, Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251114-00/?p=111792

item.title: Introducing agent-to-agent protocol support in Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Runtime
item.description: In this post, we demonstrate how you can use the A2A protocol for AI agents built with different frameworks to collaborate seamlessly. You'll learn how to deploy A2A servers on AgentCore Runtime, configure agent discovery and authentication, and build a real-world multi-agent system for incident response. We'll cover the complete A2A request lifecycle, from agent card discovery to task delegation, showing how standardized protocols eliminate the complexity of multi-agent coordination.

item.title: Powering enterprise search with the Cohere Embed 4 multimodal embeddings model in Amazon Bedrock
item.description: The Cohere Embed 4 multimodal embeddings model is now available as a fully managed, serverless option in Amazon Bedrock. In this post, we dive into the benefits and unique capabilities of Embed 4 for enterprise search use cases. We‚Äôll show you how to quickly get started using Embed 4 on Amazon Bedrock, taking advantage of integrations with Strands Agents, S3 Vectors, and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore to build powerful agentic retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) workflows.

item.title: A guide to building AI agents in GxP environments
item.description: The regulatory landscape for GxP compliance is evolving to address the unique characteristics of AI. Traditional Computer System Validation (CSV) approaches, often with uniform validation strategies, are being supplemented by Computer Software Assurance (CSA) frameworks that emphasize flexible risk-based validation methods tailored to each system's actual impact and complexity (FDA latest guidance). In this post, we cover a risk-based implementation, practical implementation considerations across different risk levels, the AWS shared responsibility model for compliance, and concrete examples of risk mitigation strategies.

item.title: Multi-Agent collaboration patterns with Strands Agents and Amazon Nova
item.description: In this post, we explore four key collaboration patterns for multi-agent, multimodal AI systems ‚Äì Agents as Tools, Swarms Agents, Agent Graphs, and Agent Workflows ‚Äì and discuss when and how to apply each using the open-source AWS Strands Agents SDK with Amazon Nova models. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/multi-agent-collaboration-patterns-with-strands-agents-and-amazon-nova/

There‚Äôs validation, authorization, state changes, side effects, logging, it‚Äôs a mess to maintain and it‚Äôs really hard to test. item.title: Visual Studio 2026 is here: faster, smarter, and a hit with early adopters
item.description: Dear developers, We‚Äôre thrilled to announce that Visual Studio 2026 is now generally available! This is a moment we‚Äôve built side by side with you. Your feedback has helped shape this release more than any before. item.title: Behind the scenes on how Windows 95 application compatibility patched broken programs
item.description: Whenever possible, Windows 95 made application compatibility tweaks through things like compatibility flags that alter the behavior of the system for any program the flag was applied to. Using compatibility flags allows the fix to be generalized: If one program has a problem, there's a good chance that another program will also have that sa Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251111-00/?p=111781

item.title: Fine-tune VLMs for multipage document-to-JSON with SageMaker AI and SWIFT
item.description: In this post, we demonstrate that fine-tuning VLMs provides a powerful and flexible approach to automate and significantly enhance document understanding capabilities. We also demonstrate that using focused fine-tuning allows smaller, multi-modal models to compete effectively with much larger counterparts (98% accuracy with Qwen2.5 VL 3B). Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/fine-tune-vlms-for-multipage-document-to-json-with-sagemaker-ai-and-swift/

item.title: C# 14 Extension Members: Enhancing Polyfill Libraries
item.description: C# has long supported extension methods, allowing developers to add new methods to existing types without modifying the original type. You can now add extension properties and extension static methods to existing types. item.description: The post shows how to use the Swiss Digital identity and trust infrastructure, (swiyu) as an MFA method in an ASP.NET Core web application using ASP.NET Core Identity and Duende IdentityServer. The generic containers from swiyu are used to integrate the Swiss E-ID and the OpenID for Verifiable Presentations standards. item.title: Free ChatGPT for transitioning U.S. servicemembers and veterans
item.description: OpenAI is offering U.S. servicemembers and veterans within 12 months of retirement or separation a free year of ChatGPT Plus to support their transition to civilian life. The tools can help with resumes, interviews, education, and planning for what‚Äôs next. Link to article: https://openai.com/index/chatgpt-for-veterans
